text: and welcome everybody Welcome to how G deployed at Data Warehouse on AWS using
netian ETL so at this time I'll go and hand the call over Brandon Brandon please go ahead hey everyone I'm Brandon
Chavis I'm the solutions architect with Amazon web services and um to start this webinar off real quickly I'd like to
talk to you a little bit about Amazon red shift which is the underlying data warehouse platform um that GE was using
via matian um and so let's talk a little bit about what red shift is and and what it actually provides as a platform uh at
a high level Amazon red shift is a service we've built to act as a fast fully managed and paby scale data
warehouse um and this service really makes it simple um and especially cost effective to analyze all of your data um
using your existing business intelligence tools so it's really optimized for data sets that range from
um maybe just a few hundred gigabytes uh to over a petabyte um but the real strength of red shift here is that it
costs less than $1,000 per terab per year which is about a tenth of the cost of most traditional data warehousing
Solutions so it's fast it's cost effective and you can launch a cluster in just a few minutes and you can also
scale with the push of a button so if we think about what red
shift uh works for in terms of companies what verticals it works for we think that red shift can provide data
warehousing functionality at a price and a performance point that really works for a variety of verticals in use cases
so if you're a traditional Enterprise and you're running your own data warehouse we think that red ships can probably save you money and add
flexibility um if you're a company that has big data for example um red shift
can make it a lot easier to start a data warehouse and make your data um available for
analysis and then finally it can also serve as a base platform for a stas offering for example um if you wanted to
add analytic functionality to some of your applications so red shift's not only cost- effective but easy to use um when
we say easy to use we say that because you can provision a cluster in as little as 15 minutes uh and there's no upfront
costs for using it you pay hourly as you use it and red shift really manages a lot of the work that's needed to set up
operate and scale a data warehouse so from provisioning the infrastructure capacity to automating a lot of the
ongoing administrative tasks uh such as backups and patching that you would have to do with a data warehouse um and red
shift kind of takes a holistic view of you know monitoring your nodes and the drives in your cluster to help you recover from
failures so shift has been tremendously popular we have a number of U customers
across Industries and verticals that are using it um maybe a good example here is NASDAQ security they ingest something
like five billion rows a day um that let allows them to analyze trading orders uh
and quotes uh and provide a lot of detail uh to their customers and Yelp for example they're
able to analyze uh 250 million mobile events a day um analyze the effectiveness of new ad campaigns
um so a variety of different use cases for a variety of different customers um across different
Industries so let's talk about the architecture real quickly the red shift is a columnar massively parallel um data
warehouse which is designed to be run as a clustered system so red shift is built around um basically industry standard
SQL um so you can interface with it through like a postgress endpoint uh which which allows you to extend red
shift to a number of different bi tools you can interact with it via a SQL console or a number of different tools
on the front end um but it has some functionality on the back end to manage very very large data sets and really
support high performance analysis and reporting of those data sets um looking at the architecture here
the leader node is essentially what your SQL endpoint lives on so that stores metadata um about your cluster and about
queries and helps coordinate query execution um the data lives on the
compute nodes and your queries are run in parallel across the compute nodes and then the nodes communicate
with each other um over a over a 10 gigabit Ethernet connection and they can
also communicate to S3 over that same connection so there's a lot of speed uh amongst the cluster and also when
reaching out to other AWS services so if we had to highlight a few
benefits of the red shift architecture number one is that it's very very fast so all the operations that you care
about from from a database management and performance perspective are all paralyzed parallelized across the
cluster um and hence they scale horizontally with the number of nodes in your cluster so as I mentioned the data
is stored on these compute nodes and the queries that you run are executed in parallel across all the compute
nodes um you can load data in parallel to your compute nodes from S3 Dynamo DB
um or elastic map reduce using a built-in copy command um in the red shift
API you can also uh back data up to S3 in parallel from your computer nodes which is a great
feature and when we say columnar storage we mean that um columnar storage basically only fetches the columns in
your database that are required for the specific query that you're running and the result of this is that you
effectively get data compression uh in the order of two to four times um so all
this compression allows you to effectively use less IO um and get greater
performance we also do some interesting things um like using large block sizes
on the actual discs in the cluster uh help us um fetch large amounts of data
and load it into memory quickly and red shift also comes with
your choice of a couple of different Hardware platforms so you can create a cluster e either using dense storage
nodes or dense compute nodes and they kind of have different priorities on uh
the ratio of CPU to memory to dis available and you can kind of pick the right underlying nodes to support your
use case um and help keep your costs
down so here we can look at some of the pricing here for some of the nodes um prices started about 1,000 terabytes per
year uh for the 28 XL uh reserved instance and reserved instances provide about a
70% discount off the on demand price so when you look at the hourly price of a red shift cluster keep in mind that um
it's for a single red shift node um and the annual cost per terabyte is if you ran that node non-stop for a whole year
um red shift also doesn't charge for the leader node so your cost is actually determined by the amount of um worker
nodes actually running per hour so if you look our smallest SSD node it lets you get started for about 25 cents per
hour
red shift is also um fully managed which is a lovely feature here because it helps offload a lot of the heavy lifting
you would otherwise have to do yourself so for example um backups are managed and they're continuous and incremental
um there's multiple copies that are made uh within and outside the cluster and stored on S3 so there's redundant CTR
backups and you can also do things like streaming restores so um the restore can
happen in the background um while the cluster can be made available for reads and wrs within minutes of initiating a
restore operation so that works whether the backup is a single terabyte or hundreds of
terabytes and then red shift also monitors the health of a variety of components and failure conditions within
an availability Zone and recovers from them automatically so for a or Regional level disasters um a streaming restore
feature or the streaming restore feature will help you get back to business um Rel L quickly
here and then of course um security is built into the platform um red ship
leverages a lot of the AWS security features you probably come to know uh and love and use currently so for
example you can deploy uh red shift inside of your VPC and you can lock down
um access to it via ACLS and security groups um you can also um encrypt all of
your data at rest you can use SSL to encrypt your data in transit um and you can also check out a lot of the um
security compliance uh certifications that the red shift platform has achieved like sock one sock 2 sock 3 and PCI
GSS and then finally with red shift we innovate very very quickly um we've added over 125 new
features since launch so that that basically comes down to a release every two weeks uh and a lot of these features
are driven basically by customers telling us what they they want in the platform uh and so if you end up using red shift and you realize there's
something that you need there that doesn't exist currently feel free to ask us uh reach out to us and let us know what your feature request is and that
really helps Drive our road map so um do Let us
know so finally that brings me to matian and matian is a data integration tool built specific specifically for use with
red shift um it has an elt architecture that delivers really fast performance um
and near linear scalability and it really helps you unlock the power of the red shift platform um it brings an easy
and intuitive user interface um and a cloud first Paradigm and deep integration into um AWS services so
matian can be used to help uh improve your developer productivity um it kind of reduces um the ramp up time for
developers to get familiar with red ship and then you can also launch it via the AWS Marketplace which means um that
setup is pretty straightforward it's a button click in the marketplace um the billing is also very straightforward
because the um billing for the product is rolled into your AWS Bill uh and it's
also very secure because it's deployed into your own VPC alongside your red shift cluster for example so what I want to do now is pass
it off to Ryan from GE to talk about why they chose Amazon Amazon red shift and
matian ETL um to deliver their cloud data warehouse requirement and what benefits they obtain from taking this
approach
